sentence.Network_en: Britain is free to adopt policies to bolster its economy.

sentence.Network_cn: 英国将对武器出售采取更具限制性的政策。

sentence.Network_en: This is not meant to delimit what approaches social researchers can adopt.
sentence.Network_cn: 这并不是为了限制社会研究人员所能采用的方法。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: via French from Latin adoptare, from ad- 'to' + optare 'choose'

entry.def: If you adopt a new attitude, plan, or way of behaving, you begin to have it.

example.ex: Parliament adopted a resolution calling for the complete withdrawal of troops...
example.tran: 议会采纳了要求全部撤军的决议。

example.ex: Pupils should be helped to adopt a positive approach to the environment.
example.tran: 应帮助学生对环境采取积极的态度。

entry.def: If you adopt someone else's child, you take it into your own family and make it legally your son or daughter.

example.ex: There are hundreds of people desperate to adopt a child...
example.tran: 有数以百计的人渴望领养孩子。

example.ex: The adopted child has the right to see his birth certificate.
example.tran: 被收养的孩子有权看自己的出生证明。

entry.def: If you adopt a physical position, you move yourself into it.

example.ex: I tried to adopt a curled-up position to avoid damaging my limbs.
example.tran: 我努力保持蜷曲的姿势以免四肢受伤。

entry.tran: 移居（某国）;选择（某国）定居
entry.def: If you adopt a country, you choose it as a place to live.

example.ex: Podulski had joined the U.S. Navy as an aviator, adopting a new country and a new profession.
example.tran: 波度尔斯基加入美国海军当上了飞行员，不仅改了国籍还换了行当。

entry.def: If you adopt an accent or a particular tone of voice, you speak differently from normal, especially to create an effect in a particular situation.

example.ex: He has adopted the accent of a Second World War newscaster...
example.tran: 他承袭了二战时期播音员的口音。

example.ex: The girl was uncertain what to do, or what tone of voice to adopt.
example.tran: 女孩不知道该做什么，也不知道该用什么口气说。

means.word_mean: 1. choose and follow; as of theories, ideas, policies, strategies or plans;
2. take up and practice as one's own
3. take on titles, offices, duties, responsibilities;

sentences.sentence: "When will the new President assume office?"

means.word_mean: 4. take on a certain form, attribute, or aspect;

sentences.sentence: "His voice took on a sad tone"
"The gods assume human or animal form in these fables"

means.word_mean: 7. take up the cause, ideology, practice, method, of someone and use it as one's own;

stems_affixes.word_buile: adopt[v.采用,收养]+able能……的→adj.可采用的,可收养的
adopt[v.采用,收养]+ive……的→adj.收养关系的,采用的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可以任选的,随意的,非强制的
stems_affixes.word_buile: option[n.选择[权],[商]选择买卖的特权]+al……的→adj.可以任选的,随意的,非强制的
opt视力+ic……的→adj.眼的,视觉的,光学上的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 选择[权],[商]选择买卖的特权
stems_affixes.word_buile: opt选择+ion表名词→n.选择[权],[商]选择买卖的特权
syn共同+ops=opt选择+is→共同选出→摘要
ad一再+opt选择→一再选择出来→采用,采纳

Sentence.sentence: Adopt a flexible approach to solving problems.
Familiar consumer products are being adopted by businesses, government and the armed forces.
Since 1976 the act has been amended to include computer software and guidelines have been adopted for fair use of television broadcasts.
Individuals and companies adopted self-protection measures.

Kapur points out that while the model adopted by many teachers when introducing students to new knowledge―providing lots of structure and guidance early on, until the students show that they can do it on their own―makes intuitive sense, it may not be the best way to promote learning.

sentences.cn: 许多无子女的夫妇收养孩子。

means.word_mean: 采用, 采纳, 采取

sentences.en: The factories have adopted the newest modern technology.
sentences.cn: 那几家工厂采用了现代的最新技术。

sentences.en: After going to France he soon adopted the French way of life.
sentences.cn: 他去法国后, 很快就接受了法国的生活方式。

jushi.english: His proposal was adopted by the committee.
jushi.chinese: 他的建议被委员会采纳。

jushi.english: The factories have adopted the newest modern technology.
jushi.chinese: 那几家工厂采用了现代的最新技术。

jushi.english: The school must adopt new methods of teaching foreign languages.
jushi.chinese: 学校必须采取教授外国语的新方法。
